intro: Bakerella tricostata, commonly known as the three-costed bakerella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Bakerella tricostata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
